sen.j: 閑院宮孝仁親王（かんいんのみやたつひとしんのう、寛政4年4月28日 (旧暦)（1792年6月17日） - 文政7年2月9日 (旧暦)（1824年3月9日））は、江戸時代の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Tatsuhito (June 17, 1792 - March 9, 1824) was a member of the Imperial Family in Edo Period.
Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Tatsuhito (June 17, 1792 - March 9, 1824) was a member of the Imperial Family during the Edo Period.
Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Tatsuhito (June 17, 1792 - March 9, 1824) was a member of the Imperial family during the Edo Period.

sen.j: 世襲親王家、閑院宮第4代当主。
sen.e: The fourth head of the hereditary house of prince, Kaninnomiya family.
The fourth head of the hereditary house of prince, Kaninnomiya family.
The fourth head of the hereditary house of prince, Kaninnomiya family.

sen.j: 幼名は寿宮（ひさのみや）。
sen.e: His childhood name was Hisanomiya.
His childhood name was Hisanomiya.
His childhood name was Hisanomiya.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)5年（1808年）に親王宣下、元服、常陸太守。
sen.e: Given the title of Imperial Prince, celebrated his coming of age, and appointed to the governor of Hitachi Province in 1808.
Given the title of Imperial Prince, he celebrated his coming of age, and was appointed to the governor of Hitachi Province in 1808.
Given the title of Imperial Prince, he celebrated his coming of age, and was appointed to the governor of Hitachi Province in 1808.
Appointed to Shikibukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial) in 1820.
Appointed to Shikibukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial) in 1820.
Appointed to Shikibukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Ceremonial) in 1820.
Appointed to Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince) in 1824.
Appointed to Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince) in 1824.
Appointed to Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince) in 1824.

His father was Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Haruhito.
His father was Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Haruhito.
His father was Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Haruhito.

sen.j: 御息所は関白鷹司政熙の娘、藤原吉子。
sen.e: His wife was FUJIWARA no Yoshiko, a daughter of a chancellor, Masahiro TAKATSUKASA.
His wife was FUJIWARA no Yoshiko, the daughter of chancellor, Masahiro TAKATSUKASA.
His wife was FUJIWARA no Yoshiko, the daughter of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor), Masahiro TAKATSUKASA.
sen.cmt: Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor)に訂正しました。

sen.e: Empress: Yoshiko TAKATSUKASA (Matsugimi)
sen.cmt: 松君の読みは確認できませんでした。また、吉子の読みには「よしこ」「ちかこ」の２通りがヒットしましたが、ヒット数の多い「よしこ」を採用しました。
sen.e: Empress: Yoshiko TAKATSUKASA (Matsugimi)

sen.j: 第二王子：閑院宮愛仁親王（第五代閑院宮）
sen.e: The second prince: Kaninnomiya Imperial Prince Naruhito (The 5th head of the Kaninnomiya family)

sen.j: 第三王子：教仁法親王（妙法院宮）
sen.e: The third prince: Monk-Imperial Prince 教仁 (Nohrihito?) (Myohoinnomiya)

sen.j: 第三王女：昌宮 佳子女王（田安家徳川慶頼室）
sen.e: The third princess: Princess Morinomiya Akiko (Wife of Yoshiyori TOKUGAWA in the Tayasu family)

sen.j: 御息所の鷹司吉子は子の愛仁親王没後、閑院宮家の当主格に遇された。
sen.e: After the death of her son, Imperial Prince Naruhito, the Empress Yoshiko TAKATSUKASA was received at a position equivalent to the head.
